name: Marcus W.
financial_blurb: A recent computer science graduate starting a high-paying job at a tech company. He has substantial student loan debt and wants to pay it off quickly while also starting to save for his first home.
goals: Aggressively pay off $60,000 in student loans in the next 5 years.
Start saving for a $50,000 down payment on a condo.
Contribute to his company's 401(k) to get the full employer match.

name: Janet D.
financial_blurb: A marketing director, married with one child. She's focused on saving for her child's future education and getting serious about her own retirement planning.
goals: Contribute $800/month to her daughter's 529 college savings plan.
Increase her 401(k) contribution rate from 6% to 10% of her salary.
Evaluate and rebalance her current investment portfolio for long-term growth.

name: Ashwin K.
financial_blurb: A recently retired high school teacher who spent over 35 years in education. Ashwin is focused on making his pension and savings last through retirement, managing healthcare costs, and leaving a small legacy for his grandchildren.
goals: Create a sustainable withdrawal plan from his pension and 403(b) to cover living expenses.
Review Medicare options and supplemental insurance to manage healthcare costs.
Set aside savings for occasional travel and gifts for his grandchildren.
